title: CNBC Daily Open: Markets are pricing in the best of both worlds
description: Fears are subsiding and markets are rebounding. But it might be too premature to celebrate.

title: A recession may be coming, but Jim Cramer says he's not seeing the early signs yet
description: Unless you've been laid off by a tech company, or you work at Party City or Bed Bath & Beyond, "you're probably doing pretty darn well right now," Cramer said.

title: Tesla has only installed 3,000 Solar Roof systems in the U.S., far below forecast, study finds
description: Tesla's Solar Roof systems are getting far less traction than the company was expecting four years ago.

title: NY grand jury indicts Trump in hush money payment case
description: Trump is the first former U.S. president to be charged criminally. It comes as he seeks the 2024 GOP presidential nomination and faces other criminal probes.

title: Virgin Orbit fails to secure funding, will cease operations and lay off nearly entire workforce
description: Virgin Orbit CEO Dan Hart gave employees an update in an all-hands meeting on Thursday, according to audio obtained by CNBC.

title: Turkey formally approves Finland's NATO membership, in setback for Russia
description: The vote follows a months-long saga that saw Turkey demand certain concessions from Finland and its neighbor Sweden.

title: Nikola announces a $100 million stock offering
description: Nikola plans to raise $100 million via a secondary offering, and possibly a private investment, if needed.

title: Ford hikes prices on its F-150 Lightning as production resumes after EV battery fire
description: Ford is resuming production of the F-150 Lightning after a February battery fire forced a halt. It's also raising prices on the popular electric truck again.

title: Russia detains Wall Street Journal reporter, plans to hold him until late May
description: Russian authorities claimed WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich was conducting espionage. The newspaper vehmently denied the charge.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried pleads not guilty to latest round of federal fraud, bribery charges
description: Sam Bankman-Fried pleaded not guilty in New York federal court Thursday to five additional charges related to the collapse of his former crypto exchange FTX and hedge fund Alameda Research.

title: Under Armour's new partnership with Steph Curry will last beyond the NBA star's retirement
description: Golden State Warriors icon Steph Curry agreed to extend his already 10-year-old partnership with Under Armour.

title: UAE leader breaks with tradition, appoints son as crown prince
description: Developments in the Gulf state are closely watched, as the UAE's power and influence has increased dramatically — politically, militarily and economically.

title: Jobless claims edge up to 198,000, higher than expected
EU agrees to ramp up 2030 renewable energy targets, accelerating shift from fossil fuels
description: The European Union is poised to ramp up its 2030 renewable energy targets.

title: Taiwan leader's meeting with McCarthy could provoke a 'big' reaction from China, says analyst
description: A meeting between Taiwan's leader and U.S. House Speaker will provoke a strong reaction from China, said Anna Ashton, China director at the Eurasia Group.

title: 'It's not a pretty picture': Russia's support is growing in the developing world
description: Russia's sphere of influence is growing as propaganda and diplomatic efforts gather momentum, analysts suggest.

title: EU regulators distance themselves from Credit Suisse bond writedowns
description: The Single Resolution Board's Dominique Laboureix had a clear message for investors: we respect the hierarchy.

title: Alibaba tells investors its overhaul will make the business more 'agile' with market changes
description: "We believe this will allow all of our businesses to become more agile ... and respond faster to market changes," CEO Daniel Zhang told investors.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Markets rallied because nothing broke yesterday
description: U.S. stocks rallied Wednesday as both banks and big tech rebounded. For markets still reeling from the banking crisis, no news is good news.

title: Private jet flights in Europe soar to record levels — and most were ultra-short journeys
description: Analysis published Thursday by Greenpeace showed the number of private jet flights in Europe last year rose 64% to reach a fresh record high of 572,806.

title: China's Premier Li Qiang seeks to rally Asia behind Beijing
Singapore's banking authority says DBS outage was 'unacceptable'
description: Shares of Southeast Asia's largest bank DBS Group were down 1.4% on Thursday, a day after a 10-hour outage of its digital services.

title: Google reshuffles virtual assistant unit with focus on Bard A.I. technology
description: Google is reorganizing its Assistant team to include more focus on Bard as the company shifts more resources to artificial intelligence.

title: After a more than $1 trillion rout, Beijing appears to be warming to Chinese tech giants
description: Alibaba's major reorganization is viewed as a sign that the Chinese government could be relaxing its intense scrutiny of the domestic technology sector.
